JSR 353 (JSON Processing) API 1.0-SNAPSHOT API

Java API for JSON Processing provides a way to process JSON.

See: Description

JSON Processing Packages 
Package Description
javax.json
Provides a object model API to process JSON.
javax.json.spi
SPI to plugin implementations for JsonParser and JsonGenerator portably.
javax.json.stream
Provides a streaming API to parse and generate JSON.
Java API for JSON Processing provides a way to process JSON.

This API defines streaming and object model API to process JSON. It can be used to:

  • Parse and generate JSON text in a streaming fashion (similar to StAX API for XML).
  • Build a Java object model (similar to DOM API for XML) for JSON text.

Streaming API

The streaming API is built upon JsonParser and JsonGenerator abstractions. A JsonParser can be used to parse JSON in a streaming way and a JsonGenerator can be used to generate JSON from scratch in a streaming way. It is a low-level API and is designed to process large JSON text efficiently. Other JSON frameworks(for e.g. binding) can be built on top of this API.

JsonParser provides forward, read-only access to JSON and is used to parse JSON in a pull manner. Parser can be advanced to a next parsing state and the required information can be got at that state using parser's methods. Sample usage can be seen in this example.

JsonGenerator is used to generate JSON object in a streaming way. JSON name/value pairs and values are written in object and array contexts respectively. Sample usage can be seen in this example.

Object Model API

The object model API is a high-level API that provides immutable object models for JSON object and array structures. These JSON structures are represented using JsonObject and JsonArray object models. JsonObject provides Map view to access its unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs. Similarly, JsonArray provides List view to access its ordered sequence of zero or more values.

The API uses builder patterns to build these object models of JSON from scratch. A JsonObjectBuilder can be used to build JsonObject, as seen in the example. A JsonArrayBuilder can used to build JsonArray, as seen in the example.

These object models can also be created from an input source (such as InputStream or Reader) using a JsonReader. For example, reading and creating an empty JsonArray using a JsonReader can be seen here. Similarly, these object models can be written to an output source (such as OutputStream or Writer) using a JsonWriter. For example, writing an empty JsonObject using a JsonWriter can be seen here.
